title: India’s Most Valuable Bank Set to Grow With Home-Lending Deal
sub_head: Shares in HDFC Bank and HDFC jump after tie-up is unveiled
body:
India’s biggest home-lending company and its largest private-sector bank agreed to combine, creating a financial giant that aims to ride a surge in demand for housing in the country.
The share-based deal to unite Housing Development Finance Corp. and its affiliate HDFC Bank Ltd. will result in a company with a combined loan book of 17.87 trillion Indian rupees in advances, or the equivalent of $235 billion.
